text:
Besides that I recommend upgrading Ant (1.6.2beta1 is out since Friday) Ant 
1.4.1 should work with JDK 1.4.2.

What we need:
- value of %ANT_OPTS%
- do you have a %HOME%\antrc_pre.bat ?
- your command which drives the error
- the exact output

Because I havent found any setting of -X parameters in Ants scripts.

-value of %ANT_OPTS%
i'm not sure abt this,where is the location of this paramter
-- do you have a %HOME%\antrc_pre.bat ?
No
-- your command which drives the error
c:\myproj-src\ant
Invalid maximum heap size: -Xmx128mb
Could not create the Java virtual machine.
-- the exact output
Invalid maximum heap size: -Xmx128mb
Could not create the Java virtual machine.

ant.bat contains this -X statement

:runAnt
"%_JAVACMD%" -Xmx128mb -classpath "%LOCALCLASSPATH%" -Dant.home="%ANT_HOME%" %
ANT_OPTS% org.apache.tools.ant.Main %ANT_CMD_LINE_ARGS%
goto end
creator: jyothi.yalaka@ps.ge.com

text:
The ant.bat in the distribution file jakarta-ant-1.4-bin.zip
does not contain a -X option for the java command. This must have been placed
in the file on the local machine at some stage to get a
build to work. The correct way to do this is the set the env variable
ANT_OPTS.
creator: peterreilly@apache.org
